entry.title: Crater Lake's Only Legal Access Trail to Close for Years Starting in 2026
entry.summary: Crater Lake’s Cleetwood Cove Trail—the only legal access to the lake—will close in 2026 for major renovations. No swimming or boating will be allowed until at least 2029, as the park improves safety, infrastructure, and the marina. 2025 will be the last chance for lake access for years.

entry.title: TAX DAY JUST TWO WEEKS AWAY
entry.summary: April 1, 2025 11:00 a.m. Nearly 1.2 million Oregonians have already filed their state personal income tax returns this year. entry.title: GOVERNOR DECLARES EMERGENCY DUE TO SEVERE FLOODING IN SOUTHEASTERN OREGON
entry.summary: March 29, 2025 5:50 p.m. On Saturday, Governor Tina Kotek declared an emergency due to severe flooding in southeastern Oregon. Kotek said, “Floodwaters in Harney County and on the Burns Paiute Reservation have created serious public health and environmental hazards and they need all hands on deck.
